result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Billy L Croon

defendant.name: Croon, Billy L

records.addlTxt:
2:18 PM Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Billy L Croon in court.  Attorney Richard Louis Yonko in court for Billy L Croon. V. Girard - Clerk 
Atty Yonko - waive reading - enter NG plea - asks for return date
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on November 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
3:03 PM Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Billy L Croon appeared in court, Attorney Richard Louis Yonko appeared in court for Billy L Croon. A. Standaert - Clerk 

3:04pm  - State calls Deputy Adam Zukowski who is sworn in and testifies
Deputy Adam Zukowski identifies deft
3:12pm - Atty Yonko cross-examines Deputy Adam Zukowski
3:14pm - State re-direct
Deputy Adam Zukowski is excused

Atty Yonko - asks Court to take judicial notice of Eau Claire County case 21CF560
Court - takes judicial notice
State - makes argument and asks Court to find probable cause and bind deft over for trial
Atty Yonko - asks Court to dismiss case
Court - finds probable cause and binds deft over for trial
Arraignment scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Text Message reminder, pretrial risk report
Not be in presence of any drug paraphernalia or controlled substances w/o valid prescription

1:16 PM Prosecuting attorney Megan E. Kelly appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Billy L Croon appeared by video in custody from DC Jail. Attorney Jonathan Lundeen appears by Zoom. V. Girard - Clerk 
Court - did find probable cause
State - asking for a $1,000 cash bond- alleged to be in violations of 2 conditions of bond - no local address
Atty Lundeen - requests a sign bond - set for an arraignment in EC tomorrow - has an Altoona address he stays at when he has court appearances
Court - orders $500 cash bond 
  Not be in presence of any drug para or controlled substances w/o valid prescription
Atty Lundeen - Waive reading & asks for a speedy prelim
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on March 4, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
